abstracts.cdata!:
The Municipal Water Project in Armenia
            aimed to support the improvement of the quality and
            availability of water supply in selected areas serviced by
            the Armenian Water and Sewerage Company, the project
            implementing unit (PIU). This report provides the findings
            of an administrative inquiry by the World Bank Group (WBG)
            Integrity Vice Presidency (INT) into allegations that
            Company A may have engaged in misconduct in connection with
            the project in the Republic of Armenia. The purpose of the
            investigation was to allow the WBG to determine if the WBG’s
            framework regarding anti-corruption has been violated. The
            PIU published bidding documents for a contract financed by
            the project (the contract). Evidence indicates that
            following the bid submission, Company B informed the PIU
            that: (i) it did not issue the manufacturer’s authorization
            form (MAF); (ii) it did not authorize Company A to offer its
            goods for the contract; and (iii) the signature on the MAF
            was not authentic, and the title of the signatory on the MAF
            was incorrect. The WBG imposed a sanction of debarment with
            conditional release on Company A, which extends to any legal
            entity Company A directly or indirectly controls.
